snippet: While Steve Mills, the Knicks’ new top executive, made it clear during N.B.A. media day that signing Carmelo Anthony to a contract extension was a priority, the team’s star was more circumspect.
abstract: Harvey Araton On Pro Basketball column says that while New York Knicks executive Steve Mills made it clear during NBA media day that signing Carmelo Anthony to a contract extension was a priority, team’s star is more circumspect; says leaves onus  on Knicks management not to leave Anthony in the increasingly likely position of being the face of an era that featured him scoring more points than anyone could remember but winning few playoff rounds
lead_paragraph: While Steve Mills, the Knicks’ new top executive, made it clear during N.B.A. media day that signing Carmelo Anthony to a contract extension was a priority, the team’s star was more circumspect.

headline.print_headline: Mixed Opening Lines In Courtship of Anthony
headline.main: Mixed Opening Lines in Knicks’ Courtship of Anthony
